content:
With the forced march coming to an end, Carter gave a yelp as she was lifted off her feet, the rope still being pulled by the hardiest of their troops. By the time she untangled herself from their formation, the Sentinel had reached the ground, and she had only a moment to wipe the sweat off her brow before a ghostly intrusion was felt in a deep corner of her mind. Dread already began to well inside - there was nobody to save them from another demoralizing state, unless Ilya ...

But what came after the mental intrusion was something they could fight. Or at least avoid. 

Before the Sentinel was finished explaining the first part of this puzzle, everyone on the East side of the battlefield ran for the water bubble with a renewed sense of confidence. A disgruntled Carter could only sweep her hair with a huff, it was hardly her fault was so *predictable*. Many of the troops probably had the right idea - Carter's spell canons would never possibly bring upon a continuous hellfire like the one they experienced moments before, and she wasn't about to drop a comet on their head either. 

**"Shields. Take the front and mind the top,"** Carter instructed, **"the barrier might keep the fire at bay but some of my dirty tricks might have been copied over."**

Just as she was about to turn to the gunners for separate instructions, a green arrow formed overhead.

Ilya groaned as she watched the flames roll overhead of the group. She was tired and could only watch in reluctant awe as if it were a simple lightshow. As it came to an end, she returned to her task of rolling in all the loose rope back into her pouch. It was clear now that the forced march was over, leading everyone to untie their end of it.

The disturbance made Ilya flinch, stopping her work, before releasing it's hold. She grimaced as she thought about the various possible meanings such an intrusion had. But the words of their enemy made it clear such knowledge would be the next stage of their trial.

After looking at the sigils on the ground and the arrow above her head, Ilya started a quick, albeit reluctant, jog to the sigils of light and air. Dragging the still loose rope behind her as she resorted to stuffing it into her pouch without care, Ilya huffed out a cry of annoyance.

"Ugghhhh... If this fake me actually had my personality, she wouldn't force the original to run!"

Just for good measure, she casted a small barrier around herself.

Carter snarled in frustration as she holstered her weapons, shelved her plans, abandoned the troops, and made haste out of the water circle. She was no stranger to finding higher ground or a better position for her own attacks, but being forced to dance around by the enemy like this wasn't pleasant in the slightest - every second that could've been used to make an offensive so far had been met with endless tricks and terrain maneuvers from the enemy, forcing them onto their back foot. 

How could such a small force with such power have remained in the bowels of Visuden without attracting even the slightest of attention? Given the relationship between the two sides ... had it all been intentional? Allowing an enemy in ... and minimizing the damages with the intention of creating the perfect excuse to retaliate with all of Visuden's military power to wipe out a long hated faction?

Before Carter's thoughts spun further out, her spell canons gave off heat against her leg. She found herself under the protection of the earth circle, with enough time to vent her frustrations. 

Though both feet were firmly planted on the ground, when Carter shot went off, she still slid back a fair bit. The silver fireball soared towards the Sentinel, growing in size, spinning wide, loosing its original shape as it landed at the feet of the Sentinel with a heavy impact - but the real damage would come from the geyser of silver fire that then erupted as its feet, wildly lashing at the Sentinel trapped within the confines of a fiery tomb.

**Endings:**

A foreboding breeze sifted through the tunnel giving alliance the coming torrent of air that was soon to be. A star of fire from Carters shot rang across the field. Its flame and passage cut the battle in two. 

The bullets’ explosive range threatened to damage the Sentinel and all around it. But holding believe in its trial the Sentinel opted to protect its construct above its own live, taking the shot in its entirety. 

The bullet light lashed out against its prisoner slicing through its wooden components taking with it the Sentinels right arm and whipping its body repeatedly after. Cracks ran down its now wanning form and the rising smoke from the destruction lifted to obscure the Sentinels location.

Meanwhile, the symbols above Ilya and Carters heads dissolved. Each doing as described before. 

In the correct locations both of them had stood. 

To Carter, her circle copied that of the correct one. Overriding her own to form into that of water and earth. To Ilya, her circle reversed the elements of air and light, to that of earth and darkness. Just before the havoc began a shadow jumped into Ilya’s circle to take part in her success.

Ilya and Carter of imitation stepped forward to take the stage, while the circle of protection lifted their element around the chosen. When the fake constructs fired, two elements consumed the area and divided the land in half. On the side of fake Ilya a spell of light covered the left, while on the side of fake Carter, fire did the same. 

The shields of water and darkest held easily against these and as the spells dissipated earth lifted from the ground to protect all. It was then that air would come from the central tunnel as those elements before it had done. A blanket of wind would come endlessly, taking anything without protection and throwing to violently to its death. 

As destruction rained outside, there was only darkness within the earth circles that protected their Litho’s heroes. 
In Ilya’s barrier a small light from a match provided the slightest bit of vision. As she looked over, she would see Behemoth still alive. His skin was hardened to a shell, no doubt his power to enhance and heal. In this case, enhancing his own skin to be quite tough. 

“This thing is one hell of a bastard huh?” The crackling of the earth prism about them made his words barely audible. 

“Let’s see if we can’t kill him.”

After he said this the air current ended and the earth shield fell. Behemoth stepped into the center to cast a large enhancement on everyone. 

A circle of energy reacted over to the party providing healing and a small damage to the Sentinel. The dangerous fatigue plaguing the party would fade for a time and give them strength far beyond that of a normal mortal.

Many of the soldiers looked over to see their commander revived in the flesh.

**Turn 4:**

The grey fumes of ash lifted to reveal the nearly destroy body of the Sentinel. It clenched its remaining arm against the empty shoulder of his disembodied section. Long scars coursed across its form while flakes of wood shattered off its body. 

The creature looked up in frustration and spoke, “Not yet. All will be for naught if thou are unable to manifest thee soul.  To be enshrouded from control.”

The shades of Ilya and Carter responded to its command. Ilya lifted her staff into the air, while Carter lifted her hand. They intended to enhance the next element of choice. 

Again, the sapling lifted to alter its symbols. This time reverting to an alignment similar to the first, with North, South, East and West. 

To the North was Fire, to the East was Ice, to the South was Light and to the West was Water.

Along with this, more symbols of familiarity formed above the hero’s head.

“Know that that the element is Light and its power will be too great for any one shield to hold alone. Unify all or face obliteration.”

Symbols of black arrows signaling reversal appeared above Filuent, Octavia, Julian and Carters heads. Arrows of copy formed above the heads of Ilya, Behemoth and Cohn. Ilya had a single green arrow, Behemoth had two green arrows, and Cohn had three green arrows.

Within the heroes a small spark formed deep within their soul. Though the source was unknown to them, each had a feeling that the order of actions would have the elements copied before they were then reversed.

Ilya turned to the being that appeared before her, giving an exasperated "Welcome back" to him. Her eyes miserably spoke of equal parts confusion over his revival and exhaustion concerning the situation.

"The guy seems to be funneling a ton of external magic from elsewhere, so for now we gotta play his stupid game."

Ilya turned her attention back to the enemy just as the next round began working itself into the surrounding. Listening to the sentinel talk once more before looking at yet another arrow above her, Ilya scratched the back of her head.

"I guess I'm first then..."

Carter waited as patiently as she could inside the shield of earth - she had just mere moments to admire her own handiwork against the sentinel before earth had walled her off from the destruction outside. Once the walls fell, her eyes glanced over the heads all of those who remained - none should have perished from the sentinels tricks this time. 

"Captain!" A relieved cry broke out from the ranks, followed by other gasps and cheers. Carter's eyes widened hearing them, fearing an illusion, but was forced to accept the timely revival of Behemoth, miserable and pitiful looking as he was beside an equally pitiful and miserable looking Ilya. Whatever displeasures and grudges she held against the desperately-needed-melee-captain she had was soothed and set aside as *something* swelled from within, removing green bruises, and soothing the pain that had started to become uncomfortable in their feet and ankles. 

The mages were worked hard and catching their breath - this reprieve could've only come from the Miserable Captain. Who now sported a green arrow. Poor guy.

"Captain, can you sort out where we need to go? In the meantime ... I think those puppets he's waving around need to go. Like yesterday," she nodded towards the wooden Ilya and Carter at the Sentinel's side, dutifully aiding its creator in whatever deep magic was being prepared. "Might give us enough time to get into our proper positions."

Light fired off as the synapses in Behemoths cortex began spinning up like turbines to solve the riddle of ever encroaching doom. Four members with reversal, and three members which each copied an element in increasing order and the copying of the element would occur first.

Unbeknownst to him of why, a creeping immunity grew within all the fifteen members dwelling inside the tunnels. A seedling of power ripe to bust and give them their long-needed edge over their opponent.

Even without the help of this growing seedling Behemoth could still solve the riddle. Given that the element was light, they would need to copy darkness to all the tiles. With four reversals, it meant they needed to copy light to each tile first and then reverse them to darkness.

This they could do if each person with a copy stood however many arrows they had away from the light tile. In other words, Behemoth had two green arrows so to copy light he needed to stand two tiles counterclockwise from the light tile.

The ground beneath them crackled as he drilled his feet into the surface to create supports. Expanding his body beyond proportions, a current of air began to form as his swelling mass filled up with oxygen. None of those that resided in the area could miss the ear shattering quake that was his war cry. 

# “LISTEN!!!” 

The shockwaves of pulsing air cried out.  “ILYA TO ICE! COHN WATER! ONE REVERSE ARROW FOR EACH TILE! EVERYONE ELSE GO FUCKING ANYWHERE!”

Cracked air fell into silence while Behemoths body deflated to its original size and he responded by leaping toward the north most tile of fire, preparing to copy light onto it.

Ilya half ran with the labored breath of marathoner seeing the last flagpole at the end. As she stepped onto the sigil with ice, she spun around and prepared her book to her left side. Looking towards the remainder of the team, she launched several enhancement spells.

"... Castor's guidance. Strength of the loyal. Swiftness..."

Ilya continued to cast more and more, building up everyone's abilities. With the captain finally standing among them and morale quickly rising, she was sure everyone would love to go for an attack after this round of magic passed over them.

"SIR, YES SIR," Cohn roared with gusto, and his roar was swiftly joined by the remaining troops' roars, their morale peaking, echoing throughout the quaking chamber. "FALL IN, SPEARS AND ARROWS, AT THE READY," he bellowed, planting his own shield at his feet. The shield sunk into the ground without the slightest of quivering, and many more shields followed, beating into the earth like a drum. 

Cohn's spear flew forward last, and yet blew past everyone's in a blink of an eye, a charging rhino leading the stampede, as it were, right onto the wooden puppet donning Ilya's shape and face. And thanks to the Superior (TM) Ilya's intervention, the spears thrown flew true, sharpened by vigor and renewed hope. 

---

"Filuent - you keep the Captain on his feet," Octavia nudged the girl northward, where the Captain was submitted under rings of fire. "Julian and I will coordinate the gunners on each wing. Carter-"

"-is on nerd-sitting duty," she finished cleanly, sweeping sweat soaked bangs out of her eyesight. "Do me a solid. If you aim for wooden-Carter, take out both arms at the same time," and with a dramatic sweep of her cape, she was off, vaulting over a overgrown root towards where chill and frost clouded like mist, where every step taken became a splinter on a mirror. 

Taking advantage of the exhausted enchanter, Carter's greeting went unspoken. Instead, she snatched the old hat off the mage's head, donning it for herself, before making full use of the swiftness enchanted bestowed upon her, pulling the triggers on her spell canons with no intention of letting up until the wooden-Carter before them fell to pieces.

**Heart of the Lithos’s Tunnels and Eldors encampment:**

Above a gaping space floated a vast crystal. The metal lines siphoned energy from the surrounding area feeding into it. It was preparing to fire again. Unlike the regular Ocrobras crystals, which functioned like a battery, we found that by continuing to ascend the element it became more akin to a prism. Feeding it limitless mana, the crystal would produce a massive amount of an element of your choice, so long as it was within the eight Ocrobras could hold.

At this location where all passages underneath the city converged there was a path leading into the ground. In the time that Lithos was originally founded, the colonists did not know why the massive flood spared their settled location, or where the excess water was going. Many years later when Visuden would seek to mine large amounts of Orcobras, the mechanics behind the lands salvation would result in the mine being shutdown permanently at risk of upsetting the careful balance.

As the miners would come to understand, the cavern beneath the city leads to a location on the surface far outside the city’s bounds. When the flood season occurs the Orcobras reacts to the increased water element and consumes all the liquid until it reaches max capacity. Like a pump, it releases that water at high speeds till it reaches that uninhabited location outside the city’s bounds, sparing Lithos its torment.
Despite the current dry season, the Orcobras under the city was still ripe with seemingly endless mana, which made it the perfect place for us to set up a testing ground. 

Unfortunately, during our development Eldor intervened, they sought to take our weapon from us and prevent the war we were on the edge of starting. They deployed that horrific Sentinel with an elite force that was bound to its will and so we were forced to retreat, bidding our time. Unable to reclaim our weapon, we lay in waiting and sought help from outsiders to reclaim it.

“We are ready on your command Phoe.”

“Go.”

Not moments after the words left my mouth, the strings on the Eldorian puppets were cut. Their lifeless bodies collapsed. More light fired off from around the space reaping their empty husks along with it. 
Raging in panic that they would be unable to fire the crystal once more, the remaining Eldorians ran to the crystal. Attempting to use their own souls as fuel, they sacrificed their lifeforce for the smallest increase in energy. An ultimately fruitless endeavor which did not provide enough energy and the crystal began to power down.

Pathetic and disgusting. For the continued thorn in my side, they didn’t even have the decency to died crushed under me. Many of Lithos 1st defense leaped from the edges of the tunnel. Like the pet dogs they were, I needed little words for them to do my command. 

Ultimately, I lacked their mobility and was forced to walk around the long way before reaching the floating crystal.

As I made it to the lower floor one of the 1st walked up and bowed.

“We have found a prisoner. He does not appear to be one of the Eldorians and was without weapons. He would not speak of his purpose or who he was.”

“Hm, take him to the surface and question him there, we will get answers from him yet.”
Turning away I faced my prized creation.

“Ocrobras Prime. The weapon that will cut this peaceful era and wipe Eldor off the face of Melicau permanently.”

Lifting my arms up I stood against the crystal, closing it in my embrace.

“The Guild won’t have to deal with anymore waves of magic and based on our reports they have almost finished off the Sentinel.” Ishile said, the leader of the 1st.

Despite wrongfully interrupting my concentration, I gave him a nod. 

“It was too much to hope they would take each other out. We should be ready to greet them and retake control over Behemoth. I doubt he will be very accepting of our actions, considering his past reactions.”

---

**Endings:**

Curved light crossed over the wooden puppet. Like a balloon popping, 240 cm of raw metal crushed through the fake Ilya's head leaving nothing in its wake. Its lifeless formed fell into the shadows below and instantly turn to ash upon contact. Whatever negative magic created it, formed feedback into the Sentinel and damaged it in return.

Taking the last of her energy Filuent sought to end it all. From the far north tile, she lobbed a beam of light into the abyss at the monster’s main host. Crossing the veil the beam lit the night to its target. Whether by concentration or lack of energy the creature did little to dodge, and to Filuent’s surprise the light evaporated its form.

A sigh of relief ran over her as she believed the battle was won. But when she looked around, the sapling and its tiles remained. In the distance it was Carters fake puppet that perpetuated them, the Sentinel has moved its soul over to the last husk and with that the tiles reacted for the coming mechanics.

In order Ice, fire, and water were each copied to light. Then the arrows of reversal changed all the tiles to darkness. The shield covered them again, but as they waited more and more time passed, by which the light never came. Eventually the tiles vanished.

Our heroes were unknown to the exact situation, but it was clear that something had occurred at the Eldorian camp. The enemy could no longer send waves of elements down the tunnels.

Among all you could see the buildup of emotion. For all the pain the Sentinel has cause them, it no longer had its trump card. There was no reason to follow mechanics or care for its words. Behemoth couldn’t help but laugh.

“Kill him!” Behemoth yelled.

Carter had no farewell line ready for the old wooden spirit - a terrible mistake on her part, it wasn't polite to end this without one last goodbye, but watching the enemy limp off in an attempt to escape the inevitable just didn't quite stir the blood-lust the way she wanted it to.

Following Behemoth's bellow, Carter let loose a fireball from both spell canons. It was not nearly as impressive as her previous spells, but this one flew fast, landing heavily enough on fake-Carter's chest to cause the chest to cave-in and splinter in a sickening rattle, before outright exploding. 

A head and arm seemed to fly off in the aftermath - but silver fire reached from the smoke to reap swallow it in a fiery embrace.

A sigh from Carter followed - breathing came easier now without the burden of an elemental storm pressing against them, however invisible it was. 

"Is there *anything* left to bring home ... The Lady Circley might have wanted proof or a face to follow through for an investigation," Carter wondered out loud. Privately, she also wanted to make sure no one could find the remains of fake-Carter or fake-Ilya. Who knows what a underground cult might do with their voodoo magic.

From the covered casing of the barrels two twin shots raced forward. Each seeking to reach their destination before the other in a playful competition. The ignition of a flame spell lit a tracing tail on the twin shots and their increasing speed grew the trail longer and longer. With shared purpose they switched back and forth twinning around their formed helix of light. But with no clear winner, the 9.3 mm enhanced shots bore into the wooden shade of Carter.

The frail girls form took into the air with the inertia and the center body inflated into flame. Bladed rings of fire expanded from within and cut her form in two. The finale closed with a great shock of fireworks, and the doll of Carter was severed of its temporal existence.

But as the pieces of the Sentinel flew across the stage there was a lingering will that would speak once last. 
Foul energies erupted from the puppets shattered form and shockwaves covered across the remaining fifteen members of the crowd. The shadows of this things energy would combine with their will, giving them an age old gift and reverberating one last message…

*“Seek……Aero”*

Ability +
**Enshrouded:**
*-- Able to clearly see how mechanics of an Aero user will function without explanation.*

Watching the smoke rise of the ashes, Behemoth turn to acknowledge Carter. 
“The accounts of fourteen others, myself included, and the fact that we are alive will be more than enough proof.”

He said looking over at its remains. “That unholy thing was not human either, identity is irrelevant. Blowing the shit out of it was the right choice."

Behemoth switched his perspective to the remaining members. In the distance Filuent took to heal others that required it. Behemoth spoke while observing. “We will still need to check the status of the camp up ahead. Lets take a second to tend to those who need it and prepare to move out.”

With a bit of magic, Ilya lifted her hat off Carter while Behemoth has her attention. Soon she let out a long sigh of relief as she readjusted her hat back into a comfortable position on the crown of her head.

"Definitely gonna renegotiate a higher reward for this..." Ilya mumbled as she slowly turned to look at the survivors of the battle. Looking at their figures, covered in grime and soot, and an unhealthy amount of blood, Ilya began to rummage through her equipment. She pulled out mana potions, healing salves, and even some small snacks, tossing them around to the members.

Uncapping a vial of mana potion for herself, she began speaking to Carter and Behemoth. "I caught a peek further down the tunnels toward where the magic was earlier in the battle. Do— ack! forgot to put some honey in this one... Does the Visudens know about that damn crystal?"

“Crystal?” Behemoth hummed in a melody of thought. 

“Orcobras in nature I imagine? I can’t say I was briefed about any crystal, although we were told a weapon was housed within these tunnels. The origin of which was from Eldorian in nature. We definitely weren’t expecting waves of magics.”

The behemoth took a deep breath in. Smells of frozen liquid and burn ground littered the air in an unusual stench.

“There are several things that bother me here. The entire purpose of bringing Guild member along was to prevent Eldor from making drastic movements, but whatever the hell that thing was didn’t seem to care much about political gain. Even if it was created by Eldor, what the hell did it want? And what about its dying words? 
*Seek Aero.* 
I can’t say I have ever heard that name before.”

From the crowd Filuent pulled her light of healing for a moment distracted by Behemoths words. While he waited in thought she walked over to speak.

“Aero is part of the Tree of Fate.” She spoke softly. “I can only speak from a religious point of view, but it is considered the force the Tree used to influence people.”

Behemoth looked with a blank expression.

“It’s actually a rather niche part of the text and rather heavily debated. If you like I can explain it in depth.”

“Yeah……I’ll pass. Most of whatever you say would likely just go right over my head.”

Turning away Behemoth looked back out over the remaining group. Many were being filled with vigor once more. 

It was over, no doubt Visuden had been their saviors, and they would rejoin to the camp with praises, he thought. There wasn’t a need to linger too long to lick wounds, the earlier the better in his mind.

“We will get answers once we make it back to the surface of Lithos. Everybody up and moving.” He said turning toward the tunnels that lead to the center. Any extra words could be spoken on the road.

The hypnotic sound of echoing footsteps ran through the tunnel as the group paced forward. All had collectively gathered to make haste, and whomever needed assistance moving was given a partner to walk with. Fifteen souls marched into the abyss with only each other to watch their back.

The distance formed a veil of shadow, clouding their vision from the central conversion. But as they came close enough to their destination, their inhibitors were lifted. Above the crater floated Ocrobras prime.  Even dormant, the slivers of light split multiple times, crossing in all directions as the shard rotated slowly. From beneath the relic Phoe stepped forward, the others of the first legion accompanying her.

“Behemoth, heroes of the guild, and the remainder of the task force.”  She spoke.

“Phoe. Not that I am ungrateful for the timely intervention, but Circely hadn’t mentioned any intention of your arrive.” As he said this Behemoth looked around. The remaining Eldorian’s laid dead on the ground. Around the Ocobras prime there was a platform of metal and machinery that operated the crystal. On the side of the machinery their were several insignias, one of which was the Selhorn family.

As it clicked in Behemoths mind what had happened Phoe spoke again. “Behemoth. You and everyone else here are under arrest for the use of forbidden magics. Namely that of Aero.”

From the shadows around them more of the first stepped out forming a circle around them. 

“What?” Behemoth replied.

“I’ll dispense with the pleasantries. You all played your part nicely, my only regret is that you two lived.”
Phoe looked in the direction of Ilya and Carter.

“Worry not, your death here will be reported at the hands of Eldor and will spark the guild into motion. With their assistance in the coming war, we will annihilate Eldor.”

“I won’t let you do that.” Behemoth spoke stepping forward. The skin around his body forming a dense armor.

“Oh poor thing. You won’t have a choice. ‘Enhance by Visuden technology’ and you think we didn’t put a safe guard for if you turned against us?” Reaching into her pocket she pulled out a whistle and blew into it. 
The object itself made seemly no sound, but the effect rippled through Behemoth. Slowly the part of his body began shutting down against his will. Despite his best efforts his mind began fading away. Who were his friends? Why was he here? What were they fighting?

Eventually there were no thoughts anymore. 
On the outside Behemoth would turn to the group silently.

“Kill them.” She said.

Without hesitation Behemoth leaped forward smashing the ground. The shockwaves lifted dust into the air and knocked the heroes off their feet. Many of the first jumped into the smoke to engage.

Phoe looked to the Ishile, the leader of the first legion. “Start charging the crystal. If they aren’t dead by the time its charged, scourge the land until their dead.”

Ishile nodded, and waves of energy formed into the crystal. With that Phoe disappeared into the shadows leaving the heroes to their fate.

At the clear words of betrayal, Ilya attempted to bring forth her barrier yet again. Unfortunately, be it due to exhaustion from the prior battles or just the momentary confusion over the actions of their huge friend, she was not fast enough and was launched onto her back.

"Agh!! Shit!!" Scrambling to refocus herself, she tossed across the ground just as a soldier of the first legion slashed at where she just was. Continuing to dodge left and right, Ilya's hands started to turn less erratic and more focused, as she swing her hands in an exaggerated motion.

"Gales of the Traveler!!" An immense wind blew across the cavern, pushing the smoke away - and the soldier attacking her along with it.

"Everyone!! I have command!! Carter!! Stop the charging!!" Ilya yelled before reapplying the enhancements she thought she wouldn't need again today onto the group.

content:
In natural circumstances the sun heats the planet’s surface unevenly, this dissonance creates areas of high and low pressure. Air always moves from locations of high pressure to those of low pressure, creating wind. 

So, what happens when someone uses magic to create wind? Does the soul move each molecule by itself, or perhaps it alters the pressure to create wind? Scholars of Albion have long since asked this question. What is magic and how does it function? 

While many theories as to the reasoning would surface, one particularly interesting theory has stayed afloat. All things within the universe down to their most fundamental level are made of the same base element. We call this element…Mana. Our “Souls” are theorized to be made of something different than mana, something able to influence it.

As such, spells are the soul’s way of understanding how to alter the world. In this theory, humans did not discover the complex verbiage and symbols used to cast spells, but rather *created* them as a universal way that people can understand how to influence the world around them with their souls.

By this logic, all magic is a form of creation or creativity magic and is inherently built from the same roots. Our “specializations” are only a figment of our own design. Anyone and everyone is capable of wielding great power or none at all, depending on themselves.

While this theory has largely been criticized, it has never completely left the academic world.

Whatever the true reason, when Ilya snapped her finger air would erupt forth pushing back the shadows of dust. While this pushed many of the soldiers, the difference in bodies was far too weighted toward Visuden. 

Leaping from the lifted shadows, Behemoth dashed forward toward Ilya and reached out to catch her throat. The fatigue too great on her form, her dodge failed, and his armored body took hold of her. Behemoth lifted her into the air and the waning oxygen muffled her vision as the sands of life slowly flowed to the bottom of the hourglass.

Filuent prepared to fire against Behemoth but stopped herself. Any attack powerful enough to breach his dense hardened form would risk hurting Ilya. That moment of hesitation would lead to her and several others folly. One of the stray shots from the First Legion lend itself through her body.

From her enclosed prison Ilya would see Filuent fall. The disarray would catch more than just Filuent, as the crushing silence sought Ilya, she would watch the echoed shots bring Octavia, Cohn and three others to the ground.
As the last of the sand fell through the center of the glass, Ilyas vision would fade away. Only these final words would reach her.

“Perish.” Spoke the cracked voice of a woman.

The sound of a point blank revolver shot woke Ilya from her slumber as Behemoth *let go of her*.

From around the arena several of the Eldorian corpses rose up and began opening fire on the Visuden soldiers. Chaos took over the battlefield as panic ensued in the First Legion. A suicidal explosion erupted from the crystals control panel and Ilya could see as the Orcobras Prime began changing color from its fire element to water instead.

One of the Eldorian corpses had changed the element and destroyed the control system at the same time. The First Legion would be unable to swap the element or stop it from creating water.

When the curtain of Behemoth’s body fell, Ilya would see flowing blue hair, sparking crystal eyes and the body of a corpse made puppet. 

Simra.

“His skin forms gaps that are weaker than the rest, hit those. It will only render him down for a short time.”

Simra spoke softly, and quickly. The action itself was challenging for her to maintain. “Escape. This place drains water, when the crystal goes off, follow the current outside the city limits.” She pointed to Filuent, and the others that had fallen. “They are still alive.”

Simra's shades would not hold the Eldorians for long. Whatever needed to be done, must be quick.
